title: 103_hr3060
content: The Act may be cited as the "Electronic Funds Transfer Federal Salary Act" and aims to ensure safe, economical, and effective payroll administration. The Act, known as the "Electronic Funds Transfer Federal Salary Act," amends Section 3332 of title 31, United States Code, defining financial organizations and authorizing the Secretary of the Treasury to require electronic transfers for employee pay if deemed practical and beneficial for economy or effectiveness. The Act, called the "Electronic Funds Transfer Federal Salary Act," amends Section 3332 of title 31, United States Code, allowing the Secretary of the Treasury to mandate electronic transfers for employee pay if it is practical and beneficial for economy or effectiveness. The Secretary must establish safeguards for the control and accounting of public funds in such transfers. Employees subject to the regulation must designate a financial organization to receive their pay, and the head of the agency must report this designation to the Secretary. Transfer fees are prohibited by the Secretary. The Secretary may not charge any financial organization transfer fees in connection with payments made under this section. Financial organizations are also prohibited from charging employees for handling payments authorized by the Secretary. Employees with annual pay below $20,000 can request exemption from the electronic transfer requirement. National security exceptions apply to the provisions of this section. The Director of the Central Intelligence Agency can exempt the agency and its employees from certain regulations if compliance would risk intelligence disclosure or compromise security. The Director of the Central Intelligence Agency can exempt the agency and its employees from regulations to prevent intelligence disclosure or compromise security. Acceptance of payments by a financial organization authorized by the Secretary constitutes full acquittance by the United States. Payments to individuals can be made in any authorized manner upon request. Amendments to title 31, United States Code are made for technical and conforming purposes.
